meanings.definition: The most serious or important part of a complaint or accusation.
meanings.sent1: In the legal case, the gravamens were the key points that needed to be addressed.
meanings.sent2: She felt the gravamens of the situation weighing heavily on her.
meanings.sent3: The gravamens of the argument seemed to be about who ate the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The gravamens of the issue loomed over the entire discussion like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made sure to highlight the gravamens of the lesson for the students to understand better.

meanings.sent1: Carrying the gravamens of past mistakes can be exhausting.
meanings.sent2: The gravamens of debt seemed never-ending to him.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly complained about the gravamens of having to walk the dog every day.
meanings.sent4: The gravamens of responsibility felt like a heavy weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The gravamens of the situation made it hard for him to find peace of mind.
